intro: Gustavia serrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red and bloom during the summer months. Gustavia serrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to coastal and tropical environments.
